block.p: Elisa Jennings Scola, a daughter of Dr. Patricia S. Scola and Dr. Francis H. Scola of Barrington, R.I., was married last evening to Dr. Charles Chung Hyon Pak, a son of June Junghee Pak and Dan Chae On of Carrollton, Ga. The Rev. Alan J. R. Neale performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Columba's-the Berkeley Memorial Chapel in Middletown, R.I.

Ms. Scola, 31, who is keeping her name, is to begin a clerkship later this month at the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, in New York. She graduated from Wellesley College and received a law degree in May from Boston College. Her father is a radiologist at the Women and Infants Hospital and a clinical professor at Brown University, both in Providence, R.I. Her mother, a pediatrician, is the associate director of the Child Development Center of Rhode Island Hospital in Providence.

She graduated from Wellesley College and received a law degree in May from Boston College. Her father is a radiologist at the Women and Infants Hospital and a clinical professor at Brown University, both in Providence, R.I. Mr. Pak, 35, was until last month a senior scientist at the Liposome Company, a biopharmaceutical concern in Princeton, N.J., and is now studying for an M.B.A. degree at the University of Pennsylvania. He graduated from Rice University and received a Ph.D. in biomedical sciences from the University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston. His mother owns Sabrina's, a women's clothing boutique in Carrollton. His father retired as a marketing and sales director for Asia at the Southwire Company, a maker of copper and aluminum wire and cable in Carrollton.
